node.title: Barrister for WA police officer argues unvaccinated workers have 'the right to be wrong'
node.description: A mandate forcing West Australian police to be vaccinated against COVID-19 is a "punishment for dissent", the Supreme Court is told.
node.content:
["A mandate forcing West Australian\u00a0police to get the COVID-19 vaccination or lose their jobs, is\u00a0a\u00a0\"punishment for dissent\", the Supreme Court has been told.", "Senior Constable Ben Falconer has applied for a judicial review of disciplinary proceedings which could see him dismissed if he does not get the jab.", "The court heard the officer\u00a0refers\u00a0to himself as \"pro-choice\".", "His barrister Shane Prince SC told the court the power held by authorities\u00a0needed to be exercised reasonably.", "\"What's being done here is punishment for dissent,\" he said via videolink from Sydney.", "
'The right to be wrong'
", "Mr Prince said it was an \"abrogation of the common law assumption of bodily integrity\".", "He told the court enforcing a mandate only had the effect of punishing people who felt they could not have the vaccine.", "\"Some people feel they just can't do it,\" Mr Prince said.", "\"[There is] no evidence they provide or pose a risk to anybody.", "", "
Protesters have taken to the streets of Perth to rally against vaccination mandates for several weekends.(ABC News: Andrew O'Connor)
", "\"People who are unvaccinated are not diseased.\"", "He said part of the freedom of choice in society\u00a0was the right to be wrong.", "He said if Mr Falconer was prevented from accessing WA Police premises, he could perform data entry\u00a0from\u00a0his house.", "The employer's direction \"goes beyond what is reasonable and rational\", Mr Prince said.", "
Mocking laughter threatens to close court
", "Earlier, counsel for the state Kenneth Pettit SC called for the application to be dismissed and listed the \"pros\"\u00a0associated with vaccination.", "Among them were averting the risks of mortality, and preventing the overwhelming of hospitals, which\u00a0he said would happen if the \"virus got a foothold\".", "He spoke of morbidity rates, including \"long virus\" effects which could last for months.", "Mr Pettit argued\u00a0the vaccines were safe and effective.", "This was met with mocking laughter in the public gallery, which caused Justice Jeremy Allanson to warn he may close the court.", "Justice Allanson said he although he did not want to close the court, he would do so if that was what it took\u00a0to hear\u00a0the case without interruption.", "Mr Pettit went on to say there would be a loss of jobs through lockdowns, and a potential economic disaster if Pilbara mines stopped operating and gas was not\u00a0being exported.", "", "
Ben Falconer launched the Supreme Court legal challenge to stop WA Police Commissioner Chris Dawson\u00a0 (pictured) from sacking unvaccinated officers.
", "He spoke of the psychological impacts on those who were subjected to lockdowns, and the financial impacts on those who could not\u00a0travel interstate.", "Mr Pettit also said the applicant's inconvenience was not\u00a0worth one hospitalisation or one lockdown.", "He argued\u00a0the few dozen police workers who did not\u00a0want the vaccine were not bearing the burden alone, referring to other workplaces subject to directions.", "He also said it was\u00a0sheer nonsense to suggest it was \"disproportionate\" to prevent the virus through vaccination when there was no virus in WA.", "\"COVID is at our door,\" he told the court.", "", "
